verses.esv: 8 for while bodily training is of some value, godliness is of value in every way, as it holds promise for the present life and also for the life to come.
verses.kjv: 8 For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
verses.niv: 8 For physical training is of some value, but godliness has value for all things, holding promise for both the present life and the life to come.

verses.esv: 11 Since all these things are thus to be dissolved, what sort of people ought you to be in lives of holiness and godliness,
verses.kjv: 11 Seeing then that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be in all holy conversation and godliness,
verses.niv: 11 Since everything will be destroyed in this way, what kind of people ought you to be? You ought to live holy and godly lives

verses.esv: 5 For this very reason, make every effort to supplement your faith with virtue, and virtue with knowledge, 6 and knowledge with self-control, and self-control with steadfastness, and steadfastness with godliness, 7 and godliness with brotherly affection, and brotherly affection with love. 8 For if these qualities are yours and are increasing, they keep you from being ineffective or unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.kjv: 5 And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge; 6 And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness; 7 And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity. 8 For if these things be in you, and abound, they make you that ye shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.niv: 5 For this very reason, make every effort to add to your faith goodness; and to goodness, knowledge; 6 and to knowledge, self-control; and to self-control, perseverance; and to perseverance, godliness; 7 and to godliness, brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness, love. 8 For if you possess these qualities in increasing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.esv: 12 Indeed, all who desire to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,
verses.kjv: 12 Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.
verses.niv: 12 In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,

verses.esv:
1:1   Blessed is the man
    who walks not in the counsel of the wicked,
  nor stands in the way of sinners,
    nor sits in the seat of scoffers;
2   but his delight is in the law of the LORD,
    and on his law he meditates day and night.
3   He is like a tree
    planted by streams of water
  that yields its fruit in its season,
    and its leaf does not wither.
  In all that he does, he prospers.
verses.kjv: 1 Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful. 2 But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night. 3 And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.
verses.niv: 1 Blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked or stand in the way of sinners or sit in the seat of mockers. 2 But his delight is in the law of the LORD, and on his law he meditates day and night. 3 He is like a tree planted by streams of water, which yields its fruit in season and whose leaf does not wither. Whatever he does prospers.

verses.esv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain,
verses.kjv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain.
verses.niv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain.

verses.esv: 7:1 Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from every defilement of body and spirit, bringing holiness to completion in the fear of God.
verses.kjv: 1 Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
verses.niv: 1 Since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God.

verses.esv: 5 having the appearance of godliness, but denying its power. Avoid such people.
verses.kjv: 5 Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.
verses.niv: 5 having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with them.

verses.esv: 12:1 I appeal to you therefore, brothers, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, which is your spiritual worship.
verses.kjv: 1 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.
verses.niv: 1 Therefore, I urge you, brothers, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to God--this is your spiritual act of worship.

verses.esv: 7 and godliness with brotherly affection, and brotherly affection with love.
verses.kjv: 7 And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.
verses.niv: 7 and to godliness, brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness, love.

verses.esv:
8   He has told you, O man, what is good;
    and what does the LORD require of you
  but to do justice, and to love kindness,
    and to walk humbly with your God?
verses.kjv: 8 He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?
verses.niv: 8 He has showed you, O man, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.

verses.niv: 33 But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

verses.esv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain, 7 for we brought nothing into the world, and we cannot take anything out of the world.
verses.kjv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain. 7 For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.
verses.niv: 6 But godliness with contentment is great gain. 7 For we brought nothing into the world, and we can take nothing out of it.

verses.esv: 17 As for the rich in this present age, charge them not to be haughty, nor to set their hopes on the uncertainty of riches, but on God, who richly provides us with everything to enjoy. 18 They are to do good, to be rich in good works, to be generous and ready to share, 19 thus storing up treasure for themselves as a good foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of that which is truly life.
verses.kjv: 17 Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy; 18 That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate; 19 Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
verses.niv: 17 Command those who are rich in this present world not to be arrogant nor to put their hope in wealth, which is so uncertain, but to put their hope in God, who richly provides us with everything for our enjoyment. 18 Command them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, and to be generous and willing to share. 19 In this way they will lay up treasure for themselves as a firm foundation for the coming age, so that they may take hold of the life that is truly life.

verses.esv: 19 Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God? You are not your own, 20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
verses.kjv: 19 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own? 20 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.niv: 19 Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; 20 you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your body.

verses.kjv: 10 But (which becometh women professing godliness) with good works.
verses.niv: 10 but with good deeds, appropriate for women who profess to worship God.

verses.esv: 7 Have nothing to do with irreverent, silly myths. Rather train yourself for godliness; 8 for while bodily training is of some value, godliness is of value in every way, as it holds promise for the present life and also for the life to come.
verses.kjv: 7 But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness. 8 For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
verses.niv: 7 Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives' tales; rather, train yourself to be godly. 8 For physical training is of some value, but godliness has value for all things, holding promise for both the present life and the life to come.

verses.esv: 14 For the whole law is fulfilled in one word: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.kjv: 14 For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
verses.niv: 14 The entire law is summed up in a single command: "Love your neighbor as yourself."

verses.esv: 5 We destroy arguments and every lofty opinion raised against the knowledge of God, and take every thought captive to obey Christ,
verses.kjv: 5 Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
verses.niv: 5 We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ.

verses.esv: 48 You therefore must be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
verses.kjv: 48 Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.
verses.niv: 48 Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

verses.esv: 2 Beloved, we are God’s children now, and what we will be has not yet appeared; but we know that when he appears we shall be like him, because we shall see him as he is.
verses.kjv: 2 Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.
verses.niv: 2 Dear friends, now we are children of God, and what we will be has not yet been made known. But we know that when he appears, we shall be like him, for we shall see him as he is.

verses.esv: 10 For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evils. It is through this craving that some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many pangs.
verses.kjv: 10 For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
verses.niv: 10 For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.
